head.supplied: 31/5/94. ¶ ¶ As I have some more specimens ready for the Musée d'histoire naturelle of Paris, dear Chevalier De Jardin, do you think, that it could be arranged, that the Doctor of the ¶ June ¶ Fren...

div.p: Carton no. 14, Melbourne, consulat, Serie A, Centre des Archives Diplomatiques, Nantes.
MS annotation: 'cé no 161 1er Juin 1894' [Despatch no. 161, 1 June 1894] and 'Rep verbalement le 14 Juin' [Answered verbally on 14 June]. Letter not found. 31/5/94.

As I have some more specimens ready for the Musée d'histoire naturelle of Paris, dear Chevalier De Jardin, do you think, that it could be arranged, that the Doctor of the June French Mailsteamer
Polynesien sailed from Melbourne for Marseiles on 1 July 1894. kindly take them? Perhaps the medical Gentleman may anyhow have to go to Paris. As our friend Dr Rougier will be only some months later here, by which time other donations to the Museum could likely be procured, it might be best, to send the present articles off by next Steamer.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
I was elected into Alph de Candolles place at the Ural Nat. Science Society, Katharinenburg
Uralian Society of Natural Science [Uralskoye obshtchestvo yestestvoznaniya], Ekaterinenburg. and some other Societies
I was … Societies is written on one of M's Herbarium labels and may not be part of this letter. Alphonse de Candolle had died on 4 April 1893.
